name: The Consulate UWS
address: 519 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

reviews.text: As soon as my group walked in for lunch, the hostess greeted and seated us. She was so friendly and made us feel comfortable immediately. Our waiter, Santiago, was fantastic. He had excellent recommendations, was very attentive and considerate (e.g., asking if we had to leave by a certain time), and even made the meal more special by giving me a complimentary dessert because we were celebrating. The food was delicious. Highly recommend the grilled chicken, burrata truffle corn salad, creme brulee, and blueberry cast iron pancake! I would love to return again after today's experience! The ambience is so elegant as well. Perfect for groups, dates, and celebrations!

Had a memorable evening celebrating Halloween here! I was so impressed with the decor, the staff costumes, and the music‚Äîit was all on point. The food was amazing; we tried the short rib cavatelli and it was absolutely to die for. Everything felt so festive and fun‚Äîhighly recommend!‚Äù

The best Halloween ever!
I love that all of the staff were dressed up. Wonderful atmosphere.
Amazing, diverse music with an offer of well-crafted cuisines ‚Äî and drink service is impeccable and cute Halloween Spot lowkey!

The food is undeniably mediocre. The steak was chewy. The broth with the mussels got one too many squirts of bottled lemon juice and the cocktails were 20+ each.  The au poivre sauce for the steak was gooey- clearly using corn starch. Barely average food but at the incredible price of 450+ absolute highway robbery. It‚Äôs also just cookie cutter decor from the chain restaurant manual.

LOVELY little bistro. Beautiful, great service.

And completely undistinguished food. 'Ham Benedict' on a mealy English Muffin, with a bit of tasteless ham rather than Canadian Bacon? C'mon guys; do the classics well or do something interesting.

The Consulate Restaurant is hands down one of the best spots I‚Äôve been to in a long time! The vibe is super cozy and stylish, and the staff make you feel so welcome from the second you walk in.

The food was incredible, every dish was full of flavor and beautifully presented. You can really tell they care about quality. I tried the Short Rib Cavatelli , and it was honestly perfection.

The drinks were just as good ‚Äî creative, well-balanced, and served with such great presentation. My server was friendly, attentive, and gave great recommendations, which made the whole night even better.

Overall, The Consulate is the perfect mix of great food, great service, and great atmosphere. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon and bringing friends with me!
Hostess was very helpful with meal selections and answering questions.
Santiago makes the best Consulate espresso martini!
Incredible evening! Service and food outstanding!
Bibi got attacked by a vampire but her service and personality was amazing!!!  Definitely will come back!!!
Bibi was a great sever.
Great service and great food . Peter did a phenomenal job.
Viviana, our bartender was fantastic.   She was efficient, accommodating, professional and so friendly.   She really enjoys her job and makes everyone feel so welcome.
Great drinks and service. Food is mediocre. Viviana‚Äôs the best bartender!

Great local spot with attentive service and delicious food.
Lamb tartare is to live for.
Peter‚Äôs service was great, and the eggs Benedict never disappoints.  Also, the drip coffee was on point. (And I‚Äôm picky about coffee)
Bibi was fantastic.  Her recommendations are always perfect and she always takes great care of us!!
The food was outdone only by their service from Bibi! We had a wonderful time and will be back very soon!
Great food and great service by BiBi. Love the ambiance. Would def come back
Bibi was so welcoming.   Enjoyed our time here!
Great lunch spot.   Fig and Gorgonzola app is perfect.
Good place for brunch.
so amazing !!! bebe is so sweet

Poor Bibi, poor  Susanna, poor staff that works in this place. This past days we witnessed staff being moral harassed by this short hair lady manager. Susanna set us at a table and informed us that they were going to host an event , that we had  a time table to enjoy , then, suddenly,  this manager  brutally interrupted  us, kicking us to another table, to make a long story short, when we left, there was no one in the table she said would be occupied, all that for what? Just to humiliate the staff or to make the customers uncomfortable? We didn‚Äôt get the point.
We started paying attention to her,  and the way she was talking to these staffs was kind scary, intimidating, we could tell by their face how terrified they were, due to a toxic work environment. It‚Äôs not about the customers wellbeing anymore, it‚Äôs solely abt numbers.
It‚Äôs first time I witnessed a such thing and wanted to share it, my niece said this is the best way, reviewing it and speaking up. We cant normalize moral harassment at work.
It‚Äôs the first we‚Äôre doing reviews and it‚Äôs more than necessary  ion order to open the others customers eyes.
Joel was the best!

The Consulate UWS ‚Äì Review

‚úÖ Pros:
- Cozy and inviting atmosphere with a casual vibe
- Delicious American comfort food with creative twists
- Good selection of craft beers and cocktails
- Friendly and attentive service

‚ö†Ô∏è Cons:
- Limited seating, can get crowded during peak hours
- Some dishes can be a bit pricey for portion sizes

üéØ Summary:
The Consulate on the Upper West Side offers a great mix of comfort food and craft drinks in a laid-back setting. Ideal for casual dinners or drinks with friends, though booking ahead is a good idea due to its popularity.
Bibi is the best!
Bibi is absolutely fabulous! So fantastic!

We visited The Consulate Sunday night and it was great. We sat at the bar and ordered a couple of cocktails to start. The Miss O‚ÄôHara was really good. Tried the grilled octopus, lamb tartare and, our favorite, the crab cake, absolute delicious. We also ordered the steak frites. The food was amazing, the ambiance was very chill on Sunday evening and Joel, the bartender, was really cool and funny.
100% recommended if you‚Äôre in the area.
Food is very delicious! Everyone is attentive and friendly, especially Peter was great for our table
Peter was the best! Amazing service and food. Great outdoor seating

Bibi did an amazing job taking care of us. Great suggestions about what to order and spacing out our meal perfectly. When we were about to ask for anything, she was there before we could even turn around! Excellent meal. Have the lamb tartare and the sticky toffee for dessert.
Great food awesome atmosphere for a dinner. Will be going back for brunch hopefully soon

Love this spot, food, attention, atmosphere and vibes! Totally recommend for a chill brunch time, to just a relaxing time afternoon coffee, or wine and snacks for a date. Medina was the best by the way, super cute and attentive
Food was excellent and Bibi provided excellent service.
Bebe was the best ever !!!!! üíïüíïüíï
Bibi was incredible!!

Everything was perfect. üëå
Gorgeous restaurant, great ambience, with a team taking care of you with excellence and great care. Food and drinks were above expectations. ü§§
Just amazing! üòç Thank you!!! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Lovely place! Come here every year to celebrate my birthday. Medina and Bebe made the celebration so special! Food, drinks and atmosphere are 10/10! Thank you ladies!
BB - great service and better food!
BB is great!!!! Amazing night thank you!
Bibi is the best! And the food and cocktails are fantastic
Bebe was the best ever!!!!! So amazing and patient with my baby girl. Food and service was A1!
Had the most wonderful night at the Consulate!  Great food, personable, fun, attentive waitstaff (especially Biljana) and lovely, romantic atmosphere!
Fantastic food and service!  A real joy to dine here.
Great food and vibes!
Mark and Joelle were wonderful! Great service, food and wine.
Petar was awesome. Great recommendations, friendly, responsive. First time here and will be back.
Our server Milan(not sure exactly how it's spelled but pronounced similarly) was fantastic. Absolutely going back.

This restaurant is a must try! The flatbread, seafood tower, and pesto pasta were absolutely divine! Highly recommend their version of the French 75, it was tart but delicious! Don't skip on dessert, the sticky toffee pudding is unreal. Can't wait to come back so soon!

Constantin was an excellent server and Medina the manager made  the experience excellent. We loved the ceviche, octopus, short rib cavatelli, and especially the desserts. Pineapple upside down cakes was a top ten desserts for me.

The roast chicken here is truly a highlight ‚Äì tender, juicy, and full of flavor, paired beautifully with a side of silky spinach.

The escargots, however, were less impressive, with a sharp acidity and a hint of brininess that didn‚Äôt quite work for me.

But the biggest surprise? The fries! Crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy inside, tossed with plenty of Parmesan and herbs ‚Äì seriously addictive.

Medina, Bebe, Kosta, the faves that remember my name and my order even if it‚Äôs been weeks. This has been my ‚Äúspecial occasion‚Äù restaurant in the hood but quickly turned into my neighborhood fave. Consistent, classy, but accessible. Thank you to the incredible staff, and always good food. Makes me feel special :) and what‚Äôs more valuable than that?

The Consulate is an absolute pleasure to stop by for an afternoon of champagne and oysters on the half shell. The chic, inviting  atmosphere is perfect for an intimate evening out with friends or writing alone. The service has been consistently excellent. The wine list is well curated to the suit the menu and leaves plenty of room for exploration.

We had an incredible dinner tonight! Highlights include fabulous summer cocktails, grilled octopus, corn burrata salad, and we enjoyed their peppercorn filet special with blue cheese potatos for a main course! We were too full to try dessert, but our waiter told us they are amazing and we can‚Äôt wait to come back again to try! Lovely restaurant and ambience with great service.

milan was wonderful. service was excellent, everyone was so nice. lovely new york bistro experience. all of the fish dishes were great- the crudo was excellent. highly recommend the summer dinner special selections!

Amazing dinner! Sat at the bar and Miguel (the bartender) was fantastic. Great service, amazing drink mixer (ask for the special Pisco Sour) and sit back, enjoy! The food was delicious, ambience beautiful, overall great experience. We will come back often. Thank you, Miguel and the whole Consulate team.

Miguel the bartender was great! I love that their happy hour starts at 3:30. The food was amazing, probably the best truffle fries I've ever had. I had 2 cocktails and they were both phenomenal! 10/10 can't wait to come back!

This is my favorite bar on the UWS! It‚Äôs beautiful‚Ä¶somehow manages to transport you to Paris if you don‚Äôt overthink it. Very beautiful and sophisticated vibe here. I love to sit at this comfortable, welcoming bar for a flawlessly made classic cocktail. Claudio is the best bartender and a treasure! Even though I‚Äôm not here a lot, he remembers my name and makes me feel like a VIP. Highly recommend this place!

Suzanne‚Äô the host is always nice.
Happy Hours Appetizers were reasonably priced but very small portions
Bibi was spectacular and helped us out throughout the night. She has a bright personality and all the food that came out was above and beyond what we expected!! Can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Spectacular food, wonderful and friendly service. The baked shrimp and sticky toffee cake were especially impressive!

We dined at the original NYC Consulate on the Upper West Side today. While the restaurant's decor isn't as new as the Midtown location, the food and service are just as fabulous. This place is a gem for residents of the UWS and NYC in general!
I had an amazing time at The Consulate! The drinks and food are incredible as well as the atmosphere. Sophia was such a friendly hostess. I got the gnocchi and it was literally to die for.

Ceviche was really small and bite sized. The cocktails were great. The atmosphere was nice. We came here for the happy hour on Monday and it quickly filled up for dinner. There was live classical music. Love the ambiance. Spent a little over $30 for a drink and small app for hh

We celebrated our post-wedding dinner at The Consulate on March 1st with 19 of our closest friends and family and honestly, it was perfect.

The food was incredible, but what made the night truly special was the people. Tonchi and our server Milan Iloski were warm, kind, and so attentive. We‚Äôre really grateful for how genuinely they took care of us.

The whole team made us feel right at home. Everyone was friendly, welcoming, and full of good energy. You could really feel the love in the room.

Choosing The Consulate for this night was one of the best decisions we made. Huge thanks to the entire team. We‚Äôll remember this evening forever.

Warm, cosy atmosphere. Brunch selection is very versatile. We enjoyed delicious and healthy meals and our server Miguel was wonderful and attentive. The hostess did a great job accommodating our special seating request. Highly recommended.
This is a fine spot for a gastronomic treat. The quality of the food and service is exemplary. It has the christening of fine dining in an approachable atmosphere. Try the steak frites.

I made a reservation to celebrate an engagement and they were so accommodating. The manager and staff were all so kind and wished us congrats. They were very helpful throughout the process and the ambiance is exactly what we were going for. The food was great as always and we're were seated in the back corner which they were happy to accommodate as requested. This is one of our favorite restaurants in the city and they truly delivered. We can't wait to keep coming back!

Great brunch

Both the Eggs Florentine Benedict (potatoes on this plate were so good) & Avocado Toast with poached eggs were super well made

Absolutely incredible experience at The Consulate UWS!
The food was amazing, the atmosphere was beautiful, and the service was truly next level. Huge shoutout to Milan‚Äîhis hospitality was legendary. Can‚Äôt wait to come back. A must-visit!

French 85 is a good cocktail. Like juice. Bar starters were nice, especially tuna tacos. Super small though. Appetizers were nice, grilled octopus was fine, but not super flavourful. Pizza was good. Rosemary fries were great.

Service was not very proactive, and yet, not very friendly either. Pretty neutral, I‚Äôd say. You have to flag attention.

This highbrow, low arrogance cocktailery is a pleasant stop to imbibe and enjoy a quick meet-up with friend. Veneered by tantalizing paintings and Illuminating mirrors, this UWS gem permits an easy step back to a bygone era of learned people in high New York society. Of note, there is central air.

My mom and I walked in on a Friday night at 8pm and got sat at the bar and it was an amazing experience! Claudio, our bar tender, made the best drinks and was so knowledgeable about the wines and spirits we asked about and ordered. we will 100% be back here asking for Claudio and the mushroom Pinza!  Overall, everything was phenomenal!

This restaurant is 12/10. Bibi was amazing and was even sweet enough to make recommendations and let me tell you I‚Äôm glad she did. Food was delicious and even gave a complimentary app which doesn‚Äôt happen anymore these days. The vibe was grown sexy and chill. Love the atmosphere and decor. Will definitely come back and recommend to my friends and family.

Great atmosphere and high quality food overall. My ribeye was slightly disappointing, had much better. It was definitely not medium rare. And the side came when I was almost finished. All other dishes and drinks were great though.

Miguel me atendi√≥ con una gran sonrisa ,estuvo atento a mi, fue cordial y me sirvi√≥ todo a tiempo!!! El ceviche estuvo bueno!!
Consulate is a great place to experience, great food flavors. A very cozy place with great cocktails. 100% recommended. Miguel one of the best!

Amazing! Can‚Äôt say anything bad. They were able to sit us early. The flatbread and burger were delicious. Drinks were all on point jardin and touch of ginger were our fav. Our waitress Bibi was a sweetheart. Will definitely be back!!

Lots of dark wood, old family photos, neighborhood crowd, and faux memorabilia give this spot a warm, clubby feel. We ate a variety of French and New American dishes (escargots, Caesar salad, a burger, grilled fish, lots of seasonal vegetables) from their menu and really enjoyed it all. Great service, comfy booths and quiet enough for good conversation. Good for date night or entertaining.

Love this spot! The ambiance, staff and food is top tier! The short rib cavatelli is the way to go, and you should definitely share the tuna tartare. Claudio is the BEST bartender, so come thirsty. Perfect for a girls night, date night, or a solo night at the bar.

First time here and I was blown away by this dining experience. Had an amazing time since I arrived. Cozy & classy atmosphere, beautiful decoration and pleasant background music. Exceptional service, everyone was attentive and friendly.

The food was SOOO delicious and with so much flavors. The short rib cavatelli, omgg üî•üî• you have to try it. The salmon was cooked to perfection. The tuna in the salad was so fresh so good.

Everything I ordered:

ü•ó Nicoise Salad
üçù Short Rib Cavatelli
ü•© Steak Fries with rosemary fries
üê° Salmon

They have lunch special menus with different good options for each day.

I highly recommend The Consulate UWS for your next dining experience.

Cool posh spot in the upper west side, based on serving locals. I‚Äôd go back if I lived in the area and wanted something familiar that didn‚Äôt require planning in advance since reservations were easy.
We caught them on a live jazz night; the band was great!
We had the wagyu sirloin special over stir fried veggies in teriyaki, a mushroom truffle flatbread and grilled artichoke app. All were flavorful and well prepared.
The staff was friendly and accommodating but we found ourselves flagging people down to get service.

Very nice service from Miki and bibi the food was delicious had a tomahawk and can't complain very tender, octopus and bone marrow were a highlight, Salted caramel Gelato to end it off very good. Thank you
I have been to this restaurant more than any other restaurant in the upper west side of New York! Bibi provides the most amazing hospitality every time, been there for years and continues to delight!

Consulate Restaurant ‚Äì A Weekly Ritual of Excellence
Since arriving in New York this January, we‚Äôve made the Consulate our cherished ritual‚Äîweek after week, it continues to impress. The service is nothing short of exceptional, thanks to the gracious and attentive team of Milan, Bibi, Laura, and Medina. Each visit feels like a homecoming, with their warmth, professionalism, and genuine hospitality elevating every experience.

Whether it‚Äôs a casual brunch or a celebratory dinner, they strike the perfect balance between efficiency and charm. Their attention to detail and effortless grace make the Consulate not just a restaurant, but a place we look forward to returning to. We wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone seeking refined service and a welcoming atmosphere in the heart of the Upper West Side.

Great upscale but approachable spot on the upper west side. They have a great cocktail program that changes seasonally, but also don‚Äôt miss on traditional cocktails. I‚Äôve been many times for dinner or happy hour and they have a great selection of classics. Some of my favorites are the cavatelli, muscles and the burger. Also, don‚Äôt miss the happy hour. They have great little bites on that menu! The staff is always super nice and accommodating ‚Äì shout out to Mark, the bartender for his incredible service and attention to detail. I‚Äôll continue to come back to the spot over and over again.

After viewing the cherry blossoms in Central Park, coming here for lunch is very close. Upon entering, I was attracted by the retro style - it feels atmospheric and cozy, especially suitable for enjoying a leisurely time with family and friendsüíì. My favorite is the French Onion SoupüßÖ; the cheese can be stretched so long, and the soup is fragrant with onions and has a hint of sweetnessüòã.

The Salmon Eggs Benedict has a smooth and tender texture, also a must-select for brunch.

I was pleasantly surprised by the Short Rib Cavatelliüíì; the ribs are stewed until tender and flavorful, paired with cavatelli which is very soft and delicate in texture, highly recommendedüëç.

I came across this place while looking for a brunch spot for my friends and I. I‚Äôm glad we tried it because the brunch was great and the ambiance was rustic and vintage. The servers were friendly and checked up on us to make sure we were comfortable.

The Consulate is a fantastic restaurant with a wonderful atmosphere and delicious food. Julia, our hostess, was incredibly welcoming and attentive. She made excellent recommendations, including the amazing Steak and Eggs. Julia was so attentive that she even took our order herself, which was a huge time-saver on a busy Sunday morning. We also had the pleasure of meeting Medina, the manager, who was so gracious and appreciative of our feedback. I highly recommend The Consulate for a truly exceptional dining experience!
Miki and the team were very attentive. Excellent service. I recommend going to eat at this restaurant. The food is very good and the dessert is tasty.

We loved Bibi üíï it was so nice to have such a friendly server. She also spoke Croatian and could speak with my in-laws from Europe, which was so cool. Great place with great happy hour specials and everyone here is so friendly. The vibe is‚Ä¶

The restaurant‚Äôs design is beautiful‚Äîmodern yet cozy‚Äîand the festive atmosphere on Christmas Day made for a lively vibe. It was packed, which speaks to its popularity.
As for the food, I ordered the Roasted Branzino, which came with cilantro sauce and shaved fennel. The texture of the fish was spot on‚Äîperfectly cooked and flaky‚Äîbut unfortunately, it lacked depth of flavor. It could have used a little more seasoning, perhaps some black pepper or additional spices, to elevate the dish. The cilantro sauce didn‚Äôt quite complement the fish the way I had hoped, and the overall taste just didn‚Äôt wow me. My husband went with the 8oz Filet Mignon, which was served with mashed potatoes and bordelaise sauce. It didn‚Äôt have that wow factor either.
We decided to skip dessert, as we weren‚Äôt overly excited after the main course. Overall, the ambiance was great, but the food didn't quite meet expectations. A solid choice, but not outstanding.
Some of the best drinks and dining you can get on the UWS. I had an amazing time and the service was impeccable.
